detailsOfAchievement: More than 500 women in Thoubal district have been economically empowered under CDO microfinance project for pverty alleviation.2500 farmers in Thoubal, Bishnupur and Chandel districts are producing organic crops under CDO organic farming project for rural development funded by KZE Germany. People in Bishnupur and Thoubal districts are motivated and educated for their involvement in the initiatives to promote loktak lake ecosystems and protect environment under CDO bioderversity conservation project funded by NC-IUCN Netherlands. Under family counselling centre programme, counselling services are offered to women in trouble in Thoubal and its adjoining areas and 584 women, victims of actrocities have received benefits form the family counselling centre run by CDO under funding support from the central social welfare board, thereby sorting their problem. Unemployed tribal youths have been trained for ptrmoting agro-forestry practices to ensure conservation of agricultural assets, mountain ecology and sustained crop production.Indigenous people in Kwatha haverained for production of value added fermented bamboo shoot and its market management for better profit. CDO run youth guidance centre provides youths in the state with zero cost regular career counselling opportunities, which enable them to build their educational and job careers.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: More than 992 women facing domestic violence were given free counseling and legal services to the women in distress. Target groups were made aware of the laws of the land preventing violence against women. Women participation in the programme implementation is on increase.

1000 farmers from 10 villages in Chandel district directly benefited from the project. The target farmers were trained in changing their farming system to organic farming practices. Farmers were in active to produce organic crops production.
More than 105 women facing domestic violence benefited from the family counseling programme in this reporting year.

detailsOfAchievement: Brief Achievements of the Community Development Programme Centre, M.I. Road, Thoubal achouba, Thoubal, Manipur are briefly stated below on some special sectors viz, 1. The CDPC is implementing a shcme on Prevention of Alcoholism and substance Abuse (Drugs) since 2000-2001 hitherto under the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India, New Delhi (DP  I Section). Th output & credentials of the centre are commendable. All the staffs are trained by the NISD (MoSJE) and R.R.T.C.-N.E.-I, Imphal. 2. The programme of Home for Destitute Women & Children due to the Social problems and HIV/AIDS are implementing under the Ministry of Women and Child Development, Government of India, New Delhi since 2005  2006 hitherto. The capacity of the Home is 50 (25 women and 25 children). All the infrastructure are well equipped with spacious areas and well trained staffs for management of the scheme are available. 3. The Shihu Greh (Child Adoption centre) scheme are implementing for 10(Ten) nos. of children since 2005-06 hitherto under the Ministry of women and child development, Govt. of India, New Delhi (CARA) successfully under the guidance of the Department of Social Welfare, Govt. of Manipur and nodal agency (Manipur branch). The staffs and infrastructure of the centre are well equipped and spacious and adoption reports are submitted in timely for further necessary action. 4. The Centre is running a day care centre (Aspiration) for person with Disabilities (PWD) with cerebral palsy, Autism, mental retarded with multiple Disabilities of children (0-7yrs) for capacity of 20 nos. under the National Trust, (MoSJE, Govt. of India, New Delhi) during the year 2009  2010. The scheme is implementing properly and supervised by the District Administration, Thoubal, Manipur. 5. The Organization is running Coaching centre for different professional courses as Residential for outsiders and non-residential for local students specially for SC/ST/OBC/Minorities etc. without charges of Fees. Trained staffs, recreation room, class rooms, library are available. 6. Vocational Training for self income generating based to the traditional and non-traditional trades are functioning by forming of SHGs of Destitute Women including SC/ST/OBC/Minorities. The products are sole and benefitted to the Beneficiaries. 7. The Organization conducted Awareness on Gender issues, RCH, Insurance for PWD persons, Traffic Rule for Disabled persons, computer application, distribution of teaching and learning materials of disable children, drinking of filter water (hygienic) and sanitary system, on culture topics, regarding sports activities, preservation of water-shades and wasteland, climate change in the global etc. in different places, schools, colleges, Rural areas for the development and welfare of the people of Manipur. Lastly, the Organization is registered member of National Trust (MoSJE, GoI, New Delhi) since 2001 and Registration No. is 1401/MD/2001. And also partnership with Care-n-cure charitable society, New Delhi, Registered Member of India-CCM etc. The above stated are brief activities and achievements of the organization (CDPC), Thoubal, Manipur.

detailsOfAchievement: 1. Organization has able to approved 19 Oral Substitotion Therapy (OST) sites by NACO/MSACS for implimentation of OST. 2. Improvement of HIV treatment services in the state including access to 2nd line ART. 3. Visibility of the organization as People who Use Drug(PUD) network at the state and national lavel. 4. Established first Legal Aid Clinic for marginalized communities(PUD, PLHIV, MSM and sexworker) in India. 5. High court directive to instoll the vairal load testing machine and free health investigation for initiation of ART in the state as a result for filling writ pettion. 6. Mass Hepatitis-C awarness program was conducted across the state which was followed by treatment literacy. 7. Community led free HCV screening camp conducted across the nine districts of Manipur, participated by 1011 patients. 8.The same testing model was declared as one of the inovative examples by World Health Organisation(WHO) in the HCV innovative testing contest 2016. 9. Able to initiate 92 patients leving with HCV on treatment using DAAs. 10. Able to provaide free HCV treatment to 17 widows co-infected with HIV. 11. Organization also started free Hepatitis-B(HBV) screening and vacination. 12. Abstract submited by the organization was acknowledge as one of the best community abstract in INSHU 2016. 13 Organization can linkup successfully with Manipur University, All Manipur Working Jurnelist Union, Indian dental Assosiation etc.

detailsOfAchievement: Achievments: (1). Vocational Training: - As done before, the organisation has DNWO VOCATIONAL TRAINING CENTRE at Khwairakpam Leikai and training of girls & women (youth) are given in embroidering, tailoring, wool knitting & weaving. Altogether 30 trainees have undergone 3 months training course in 3 batches during this year. Not only this we have also training on weaving & Agarbati making. For rural agriculture we have training on Mushroom plantation in which 25 trainees have been given training on line this years. (2) Fruit preservation training: - One week training course on Domestic Method of fruit & vegetable preservation conducted by community fruit & Nutrition Extension Unit, Imphal was done at Konjenghajari Leikai 10/6/07 to 16/6/07 under the sponsorship of ministry of Human Resource Development (Department of women & Child Development, Food & Nutrition Board) , Gol. About 40 participants attended the programme. (3) Crafts: - Training on crafts (bag making) is done and about 40 to 45 women have undergone this training programme and after this training programme these people are capable of earning money for their livelihood. (4) SOCIAL SERVICE CAMP. The organization has done every year social service at the locality. This year also we perfourmed social service camp from 16th September to 30th September 2007. Altogether 35 women and 30 boys attended the camp. During the camp, many Nalas (Drains), culverts were cleaned and plantation of 100 different trees were by the volunteers. (5) Creche Centre: - One Creche Centre has been running with 25 to 30 children at kwakeithel khwairakpam Leikai, lmphal. These children are usually for the working women who brought their children for keeping in the crche centre. This year we have 38 children admitted in the Creche Centre. title: WRITERS FORUM IMPHAL
detailsOfAchievement: The Writers Forum Imphal is one of the five Literary Organisation recognized by Sahitya Akademi, New Delhi(National Academy of Letters ) in Manipuri Language.It was established on September3,1998 and registerd under Manipur Societies Registration Act,1989. Regd. No. 2121 of1990 Most of the literary figures in Manipur are its members. It has published 132 books. Many of the books won Sahitya Akademi Awards, Translation Prizes,State Kala Akademi Awards, Manipur State Award for literature(instityted by Govt. of Manipur). Its books also won many prestigious awards given by various literary organizatios viz. Manipuri Sahitya Parishad, Cultural Forum, Manipur, Naharol Sahitya Premee Samiti etc. Forum organized various national and state level Seminars, workshops,Symposiums, in collaboration with Sahitya Akademi, National Book Trust, CIIL, Mysore, Eastern Regional Language Centre, Bhubaneshwor,Federation of Indian Publishersetc. for the developement of Manipuri Literature & Culture,language, Tribal dialects, Book publication etc.from time to time. It published its quarterly literary journal- Sahityagi Pao- with RNI No.00273/04 and ISSN 2278-9006 since 1990. It also instituted an award - Khundongbam Brojendro Ningshing Mana- in recognition of works by playwrights.

detailsOfAchievement: Basanta Ras lila has been a popular theme in Bharatanatyam, Odissi, Manipur and Kuchipudi items Ras lila is a popular form of folk theatre in the regions of Mathura, Vrindavan in Uttar Pradesh, especially during the festivals of Krishna Janmashtami and Holi, and amongst various followers of Gaudiya Vaishnavism in the region. Raas leela is also observed as one of the National Festivals of Assam. During Raax lila, several thousand devotees visit the holy temples and extras of Assam every year

detailsOfAchievement: YOUTHS STEP FORWARD CENTRE, (YSFC), Wangjing Bazar, Manipur is a non profit making voluntary organisation in the field of Rural Development. And Registered under Societies Registration Act. of 1989 at th DCO Thoubal, bearing its registration no. 169 of 1997 dated 28/01/1997, having its Head Office at Wangjing Bazar, Manipur. Activities : We have implemented many Schemes/Projects for Health, Women and Child, Aged, Rural Development, Agriculture, Coaching for Minorities, Piggery and Poultry, Handloom Handicrafts, and Computer Training etc. for every year. detailsOfAchievement: The businesses listed here all have an interest in the recreational fishing industry in Manipur and as they support the work that N AF does in promoting and furthering the development of our fishery They add to NAFs voice when we speak on behalf of our industry and they provide valuable input to our organisation We urge all NAF members to recognise the support of these businesses by choosing to use their products and services wherever possible The Membership of NAF is open to all businesses with an interest in our industry Members receive our newsletters and window signage identifying them as N AF supporters NAF offers three levels of Membership NAF Activities 2016 Represent and advocate for the interests of all recreational fishers in Manipur Protect and enhance the quality of the fishing experiences and resource that is available in Manipur and visiting Loktak Lake Provide representation and advice to governments and others on recreational fishing issues Maintain and where possible increase access to recreational fishing opportunities Promote and be an advocate for ethical, sustainable, safe and legal fishing practices Participate in the management of recreational and other fisheries Liaise constructively with other organisations including commercial fishing organisations on matters of mutual interest Support and participate in fisheries research Promote and be an advocate for the protection of the environment when it has the potential to impact on recreational fishing
